content: stash buster spiral socks cuff down sharon stern gerstman ©2011 supplies approximately 100 yds of one solid or semi-solid color and 300 yards of mixed colors sock yarn the idea here is to use your left-overs from previous socks appropriately sized double pointed needles you can use two circulars or a magic loop but you will need to rely on stitch markers and stitch markers gauge 8 stitches/inch on plain stockinette however you can easily adapt the pattern if you like a different gauge size women s small and medium men s medium/women s large s m l instructions 1 prepare your yarn assuming that you want two socks which more or less match you should divide your yarn leftovers into two approximately equal balls and label them so you can keep track 2 cast on 56 64 72 stitches with solid color if you are using a different gauge or want a different size by all means use a different number of stitches this pattern is easily adaptable 3 work for 1-1/4 or desired length in plain rib either 1 x 1 or 2 x 2 cut leaving a tail to weave in later 4 pick out 3 of your various mixed yarns mark them 1 2 and 3 and mark the coordinating half ball for the other foot with the same numbers with dp needle #1 and yarn 1 knit 19 21 24 stitches with dp needle #2 and yarn 2 knit 18 22 24 stitches with dp needle #3 and yarn 3 knit 19 21 24 stitches then knit the next 19 21 24 stitches off of needle #1 if you are knitting on a different number of stitches similarly divide the stitches into thirds if you are using two circulars or magic loop use stitch markers to mark each third of the stitches mark the beginning of needle #1 as your starting point 5 when you are ready for the next dp needle needle #2 there will be two yarns hanging from the end of the last needle carefully pick up the lower yarn - do not twist the yarns - and knit to the end of the next dp needle at the end of this needle you will have two yarns hanging and again without twisting pick up the lower one and knit across the next dp needle then you will have only one yarn hanging and continue to knit across the next dp needle with it 6 keep repeating #5 picking up the lower yarn when there are two yarns hanging or knitting across when there is only one until you reach the desired leg length last row before heel continue to knit in pattern across needles #1 and #2 and the first 5 5 6 stitches on needle #3 you should have 14 16 18 stitches left on needle #3 heel flap on a new dp needle with the solid color knit the 14 16 18 stitches left on needle #3 and the
